timeline.bodyText:
There is also a RequestSplitEvent in SourceReaderBase. I am a little unsure if that should be reused. On one hand, it is just an event, the cost of duplicating is little. On the other hand, they are for the exact same purpose, so ideally we want just one class. That means the implementation should depend on flink-connector-base, which is doable if we move this source implementation to flink-connector-testing as mentioned in the top level comment.
What do you think?

replies.bodyText:
I was contemplating this and decided against that, as mentioned in the PR description.
The Integration Test would mostly test the runtime source operator and coordinator, not specific to this source here.
Having at least one case of the source being used end to end makes total sense, and this is the case in other tests (see for example #13513)
replies.author: StephanEwen

replies.bodyText: Adding an ITCase is certainly possible, it would not be much work, it would just be added testing time for something that I believed is already covered in other cases.
replies.author: StephanEwen

replies.bodyText: It seems that we should not reduce test time by skipping reasonable tests? The concern I has was that if there is another test using the NumberSequenceSource failed due to a bug in this source. The author of that test may have to look into the code of this source, which seems something we would like to avoid by having tests here.
replies.author: becketqin

replies.bodyText:
Fair enough. I'll add an ITCase for the NumberSequenceSource to cover the iterator sources.
Further iterator sources should then by fine with unit tests only.
replies.author: StephanEwen
